source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊鴦伽國中，與大比丘眾俱，往至阿惒那住揵若精舍。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, when the Buddha was staying in the country of Aṅga, accompanied by a great assembly of monks, I went to Anavatapta and stayed at the monastery of Amṛta.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊過夜平旦，著衣持鉢，入阿惒那而行乞食，食訖中後，收舉衣鉢，
translation: At that time the World-honored One, having passed the night and risen at dawn, put on his outer robes, with his almsbowl in hand, entered the town of Anavatapta to beg for food. After he had taken his midday meal, he put away his outer robe and almsbowl.

source_sentence: 澡洗手足，以尼師檀著於肩上，往至一林，欲晝經行。
translation: He washed his hands and feet, put his nun’s sandalwood on his shoulders, and proceeded to a forest where he wished to practice walking meditation all day.

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷亦過夜平旦，著衣持鉢，入阿惒那而行乞食，食訖中後，收舉衣鉢，
translation: Venerable Udāyin also passed the night at dawn, put on his robes, took his bowl, and entered Anavatapta to beg for food. After he had taken his midday meal, he withdrew his robe and bowl.

source_sentence: 澡洗手足，以尼師檀著於肩上，隨侍佛後，而作是念：「若世尊今晝行者，
translation: He washed his hands and feet, put his nun’s sandalwood on his shoulders, followed the Buddha behind him, and thought:

source_sentence: 我亦至彼晝行。」
translation: I'll also go there in the daytime.

source_sentence: 於是，世尊入於林中，至一樹下，敷尼師檀，結跏趺坐。
translation: Then the World-honored One entered the forest. He sat cross-legged under a tree, spreading out his sitting mat and sitting cross-legged.

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷亦入彼林，去佛不遠，至一樹下，敷尼師檀，結跏趺坐。
translation: Venerable Udāyin also entered the forest. Not far from the Buddha, he sat cross-legged at the foot of a tree not far from him, spreading out his sitting mat and sitting cross-legged.

source_sentence: 爾時，尊者烏陀夷獨在靖處燕坐思惟，心作是念：「世尊為我等多所饒益，
translation: At that time, Venerable Udāyin was sitting quietly in meditation alone in a peaceful place. He thought to himself:

source_sentence: 善逝為我等多所安隱。
translation: Bhagavān, it's for us that we have so much peace.

source_sentence: 世尊於我除眾苦法，增益樂法。
translation: Bhagavān, the Bhagavān removes all the painful dharmas from me and increases the pleasant dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊於我除無量惡不善之法，增益無量諸善妙法。」
translation: Bhagavān, you've removed measureless bad and unskillful qualities from me and increased measureless good and wonderful qualities.

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷則於晡時從燕坐起，往詣佛所，稽首佛足，却坐一面，世尊告曰：「烏陀夷！
translation: Then, in the late afternoon, Venerable Udāyin rose from his seat in meditation and approached the Buddha. Paying respect with his head at the Buddha’s feet, he sat to one side. The World-honored One said:

source_sentence: 無有所乏，安隱快樂，氣力如常耶？」
translation: Is there nothing lacking, is it peaceful and happy, and is its energy as usual?

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷白曰：「唯然。
translation: Venerable Udāyin said, Yes.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我無所乏，安隱快樂，氣力如常。」
translation: I have nothing to lack, am peaceful and happy, and my energy is as usual.

source_sentence: 世尊復問曰：「烏陀夷！
translation: The Bhagavān again asked, Udayana!

source_sentence: 云何汝無所乏，安隱快樂，氣力如常耶？」
translation: How are you not lacking anything, how are you comfortable and happy, and how is your energy as usual?

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷答曰：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Udāyin replied, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我獨在靖處燕坐思惟，心作是念：『世尊為我等多所饒益，善逝為我等多所安隱。
translation: World-honored One, I sat quietly and thought to myself: O World-honored One, the World-honored One (i.e., the Tathāgata) is able to provide us with a great deal of benefit and that well-gone one is able to make us at ease.

source_sentence: 世尊於我除眾苦法，增益樂法。
translation: Bhagavān, the Bhagavān removes all the painful dharmas from me and increases the pleasant dharmas.

source_sentence: 世尊於我除無量惡不善之法，增益無量諸善妙法。』
translation: Bhagavān, you've removed measureless bad and unskillful qualities from me and increased measureless good and wonderful qualities.'

source_sentence: 世尊昔時告諸比丘：『汝等斷過中食。』
translation: The Bhagavān once told the monks, 'You must stop eating midday.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等聞已，不堪不忍，不欲不樂。
translation: Having heard it, we were unable, unable, unwilling, and unhappy.

source_sentence: 若有信梵志、居士往至眾園，廣施作福，我等自手受食，而世尊今教我斷是，
translation: World-honored One, if there is anyone who believes that the brāhmaṇas and wealthy householders go to various parks and perform extensive meritorious deeds, then we will receive food from our own hands. The World-honored One has now taught us to abandon this practice.

source_sentence: 善逝教我絕是。
translation: Well-gone One teaches that self is cut off.

source_sentence: 復作是說：『此大沙門不能消食。』
translation: Again, he said, 'This great ascetic can't eat.'

source_sentence: 然我等於世尊威神妙德敬重不堪，是故我等斷中後食。
translation: We, however, are incapable of revering the World-honored One’s awesome and marvelous qualities. For this reason we abstain from eating after noon.

source_sentence: 「復次，昔時世尊告諸比丘：『汝等斷夜食。』
translation: Furthermore, in the past, the Bhagavān addressed the monks, 'You must stop eating at night.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等聞已，不堪不忍，不欲不樂，於二食中最上、最妙、最勝、最美者，
translation: Having heard this, we were unable to bear it. We neither wished for it nor delighted in it. It was the best of the two kinds of food, the most wonderful, the most excellent, and the most delicious.

source_sentence: 而世尊今教我斷是，善逝教我絕是，復作是說：『此大沙門不能消食。』
translation: The Bhagavān now teaches me to stop it, and the Bhagavān teaches me to stop it. Again, he says, 'This great ascetic can't eat this food.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 昔時有一居士，多持種種淨妙食飲，還歸其家，勅內人曰：『汝等受此舉著一處，
translation: Formerly there was a householder who had many kinds of delicious food and drink to offer. When he returned home, he said to the people living in his house, “Take this food and drink and put it in one place.

source_sentence: 我當盡共集會夜食，不為朝中。』
translation: I will gather all of them together for the night's food and won't eat it in the morning.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若於諸家施設極妙最上食者，唯有夜食，我為朝中，而世尊今教我斷是，
translation: World-honored One, if you establish the highest and most sublime food at all households, it is for evening meals only. I am eating in the morning. The World-honored One has now taught me to eliminate this kind of food.

source_sentence: 善逝教我絕是，復作是說：『此大沙門不能消食。』
translation: Well-gone One, you taught me to stop this, and you again said, 'This great ascetic can't eat.'

source_sentence: 然我等於世尊威神妙德敬重不堪，是故我等斷於夜食。
translation: We, however, are unworthy of the World-honored One’s awesome and marvelous virtue and reverence. For this reason we abstained from eating at night.

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我復作是念：『若有比丘非時入村而行乞食，或能逢賊，作業不作業，
translation: Again, I thought: If a monk enters a village at an ungodly hour to solicit alms or if he meets a thief who does or doesn’t do what should be done.

source_sentence: 或逢虎逢鹿，或逢虎鹿，或逢豹逢羆，或逢豹羆，或往如是處，或逢惡象、惡馬、惡牛、惡狗，
translation: They may meet a tiger and a deer, or they may meet a tiger and a deer, or they may meet a wild elephant, a wild horse, a wild ox, or a wild dog.

source_sentence: 或值蛇聚，或得塊擲，或得杖打，或墮溝瀆，或墮廁中，或乘臥牛，或墮深坑，
translation: They may meet a group of snakes, or they may be thrown into a lump, or beaten with a stick, or fall into a ditch, or into a pit, or into a toilet, or on a cow-bed, or into a deep pit.

source_sentence: 或入刺中，觀見空家，入如是家，若彼入已，女人見之，或呼共行惡不淨行。』
translation: Perhaps he enters into a thorn, observes an empty house, and enters such a house; if he enters it, the woman sees it, or calls it together to engage in bad and impure behavior.'

source_sentence: 「世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 昔一比丘夜闇微雨，睒睒掣電，而非時行入他家乞食。
translation: Formerly a bhikṣu, when it was raining in the darkness of night and lightning flashed thunder and lightning, went to another house at an ungodly hour to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 彼家婦人爾時出外洗蕩食器，彼時婦人於電光中遙見比丘，謂為是鬼，
translation: The wife of that house then went out to wash the dishes and food containers. At that moment, in the lightning flash, she saw the monk from a distance and thought he was a ghost.

source_sentence: 見已驚怖，身毛皆竪，失聲大呼，即便墮娠，而作是語：『尊是鬼！
translation: Seeing this, he was startled and frightened, his hair standing on end all over his body. He cried out in distress and fell pregnant, saying:

source_sentence: 尊是鬼！』
translation: Venerable is a ghost!'

source_sentence: 時，彼比丘語婦人曰：『妹！
translation: The monk then said to the woman, 'Sister!

source_sentence: 我非鬼，我是沙門，今來乞食。』
translation: I'm not a ghost; I'm an ascetic, and now I'm here to beg for food.'

source_sentence: 爾時，婦人恚罵比丘至苦至惡，而作是語：『令此沙門命根早斷，令此沙門父母早死，
translation: At that time the woman abused the bhikṣu, inflicting extreme pain and suffering upon him. She said, “May this śramaṇa have his life span soon terminated!

source_sentence: 令此沙門種族絕滅，令此沙門腹裂破壞，禿頭沙門以黑自纏，無子斷種，
translation: That will cause the seeds of this ascetic’s family to perish. That will cause the belly and stomach of this renunciant to split open and break into pieces. The bald-headed renunciant, tethered by his own blackness, without any offspring, will cut off their seeds.

source_sentence: 汝寧可持利刀自破其腹，不應非時夜行乞食，坐此沙門而墮我娠。』
translation: You should rather break your own belly with a sharp sword, and you shouldn't go out to solicit alms at an ungodly hour of the night to sit here as a monk and fall into my pregnancy.'

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我憶彼已，便生歡悅。
translation: Having remembered them, I became delighted.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我因此歡悅遍充滿體，正念正智，生喜、止、樂、定。
translation: Because of this, I rejoice and pervade my body, right mindfulness and right attentiveness give rise to joy, tranquility, bliss, and concentration.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我因此定遍充滿體，正念正智。
translation: Because of this concentration, I pervade the essence of right mindfulness and right attentiveness.

source_sentence: 如是，世尊！
translation: So it is, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我無所乏，安隱快樂，氣力如常。」
translation: I have nothing to lack, am peaceful and happy, and my energy is as usual.

source_sentence: 世尊歎曰：「善哉！
translation: The Bhagavān praised him, saying, Good!

source_sentence: 善哉！
translation: Excellent, good!

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 汝今不爾如彼癡人。
translation: 'Now, you're not like that foolish man.

source_sentence: 彼愚癡人，我為其說：『汝等斷此。』
translation: That foolish man, I'll tell him, 'You stop this.'

source_sentence: 彼作是說：『此是小事，何足斷之？
translation: They say, 'This is a minor matter, so why would they stop it?'

source_sentence: 而世尊今教我斷此，善逝令我絕此。』
translation: Now, the Bhagavān has taught me to stop this, and Sugata has caused me to stop this.'

source_sentence: 亦如是說：『此大沙門不能消食，彼不斷此，彼但於我生不可、不忍，
translation: Again, the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas do not accept this kind of food. They simply say, “This great śramaṇa or brāhmaṇa is unable to digest his food.” If he does so, they will not stop eating [and drinking] from him.

source_sentence: 及餘比丘善護持戒者，亦復為彼生不可、不忍。』
translation: And the other monks who well guard and observe the precepts will also give rise to what's unacceptable and intolerable for them.'

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼癡人所縛極堅極牢，轉增轉急，不可斷絕，不得解脫。
translation: That deluded person's binding is so strong and so strong that it grows more and more intense, uninterrupted, and doesn't attain liberation.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 猶如有蠅，為涕唾所縛，彼在其中或苦或死。
translation: It's like a fly that's bound by tears and spittle, and while it's there, either painful or dead.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 若人作是說彼蠅所縛，不堅不牢，不轉增急而可斷絕，則得解脫者，為正說耶？」
translation: If someone says that they're bound by those flies, aren't strong and not firm, don't grow more intense and can be cut off, then they'll attain liberation, is this the correct explanation?

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷白曰：「不也。
translation: Venerable Udāyin said, No.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 蠅為涕唾所縛，彼於其中或苦或死。
translation: The flies are bound by tears and spittle, and they may experience pain or death in them.

source_sentence: 是故，世尊！
translation: Therefore, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼蠅所縛，極堅極牢，轉增轉急，不可斷絕，不得解脫。」
translation: They're bound by those flies, which are extremely hard and extremely strong, increasing in strength and urgency, uninterrupted and unable to be freed.

source_sentence: 「烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼愚癡人，我為其說：『汝等斷此。』
translation: That foolish man, I'll tell him, 'You stop this.'

source_sentence: 彼作是說：『此是小事，何足斷之？
translation: They say, 'This is a minor matter, so why would they stop it?'

source_sentence: 而世尊今教我斷此，善逝令我絕此。』
translation: Now, the Bhagavān has taught me to stop this, and Sugata has caused me to stop this.'

source_sentence: 亦如是說：『此大沙門不能消食，彼不斷此，彼但於我生不可、不忍，
translation: Again, the śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas do not accept this kind of food. They simply say, “This great śramaṇa or brāhmaṇa is unable to digest his food.” If he does so, they will not stop eating [and drinking] from him.

source_sentence: 及餘比丘善護持戒者，亦復為彼生不可、不忍。』
translation: And the other monks who well guard and observe the precepts will also give rise to what's unacceptable and intolerable for them.'

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼癡人所縛極堅極牢，轉增轉急，不可斷絕，不得解脫。
translation: That deluded person's binding is so strong and so strong that it grows more and more intense, uninterrupted, and doesn't attain liberation.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 若族姓子我為其說：『汝等斷此。』
translation: If there are clansmen, I'll tell them, 'You stop this.'

source_sentence: 彼不作是說：『此是小事，何足斷之？
translation: They don't say, 'This is a trivial thing, so why would they stop it?'

source_sentence: 而世尊今教我斷此，善逝令我絕此。』
translation: Now, the Bhagavān has taught me to stop this, and Sugata has caused me to stop this.'

source_sentence: 亦不如是說：『此大沙門不能消食，彼便斷此，彼不於我生不可、不忍，
translation: Nor is it the same as saying, 'This great renunciant can't eat, so he stops eating here. He won't be born with me and won't tolerate it.

source_sentence: 及餘比丘善護奉戒者，亦不為彼生不可、不忍。』
translation: And the other monks who well guard and adhere to the precepts won't be allowed or tolerated by them.'

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼族姓子所縛不堅不牢，不轉增急，而可斷絕，則得解脫。
translation: Those clansmen’s bonds are neither strong nor weak, and they do not develop any urgency. They can be severed and then attain liberation.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 猶如象王，年至六十，而以憍慠摩訶能伽，牙足體具，筋力熾盛，彼所堅縛，
translation: It is as if an elephant king were to reach the age of sixty years old, wearing a great canopy with tusks, legs, and body empowered by strong tendons that bind it firmly.

source_sentence: 若怒力轉身，彼堅縛者，則便斷絕，還歸本所。
translation: If someone's body is transformed by the power of anger, and they're firmly bound, then they'll be cut off and return to their original place.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 若人作是說彼大象王年至六十，而以憍慠摩訶能伽，牙足體具，筋力熾盛，
translation: If someone says this, “That great elephant king will reach the age of sixty years old,” and yet he is endowed with tusks, feet, and bodily embellishments as well as powerful tendons.

source_sentence: 彼縛極堅極牢，轉增轉急，不可斷絕，不得解脫者，為正說耶？」
translation: Is it correct to say that their bonds are extremely hard and extremely strong, which grow in strength and urgency, cannot be cut off, and don't attain liberation?

source_sentence: 尊者烏陀夷白曰：「不也。
translation: Venerable Udāyin said, No.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼大象王年至六十，而以憍慠摩訶能伽，牙足體具，筋力熾盛。
translation: The king of the great elephants, when he was sixty years old, possessed a large cane with tusks, feet, and body embellishments as well as strong tendons.

source_sentence: 彼所堅縛，若怒力轉身，彼堅縛者，則便斷絕，還歸本所。
translation: If someone's body is transformed by the power of anger, that person's firmly bound, then they'll be cut off and return to their original place.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是故彼大象王年至六十，而以憍慠摩訶能伽，牙足體具，筋力熾盛。
translation: That's why the great elephant king was 60 years old, yet he had a large cane with tusks, feet, and body embellishments, and his tendons were so strong.

source_sentence: 彼縛不堅不牢，不轉增急，而可斷絕，則得解脫。」
translation: They're bound, not firm or fast, and they don't develop increasing urgency; but if they can be cut off, then they'll attain liberation.

source_sentence: 「如是，烏陀夷！
translation: So it is, Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼族姓子我為其說：『汝等斷此。』
translation: Those clansmen, I'll tell them, 'You stop this.'

source_sentence: 彼不作是說：『此是小事，何足斷之？
translation: They don't say, 'This is a trivial thing, so why would they stop it?'

source_sentence: 而世尊今教我斷此，善逝令我絕此。』
translation: Now, the Bhagavān has taught me to stop this, and Sugata has caused me to stop this.'

source_sentence: 亦不如是說：『此大沙門不能消食，彼便斷此，彼不於我生不可、不忍，
translation: Nor is it the same as saying, 'This great renunciant can't eat, so he stops eating here. He won't be born with me and won't tolerate it.

source_sentence: 及餘比丘善護持戒者，亦不為彼生不可、不忍。』
translation: And the other monks who well guard and observe the precepts won't allow or tolerate them to arise.'

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 彼族姓子所縛不堅不牢，不轉增急，而可斷絕，則得解脫。
translation: Those clansmen’s bonds are neither strong nor weak, and they do not develop any urgency. They can be severed and then attain liberation.

source_sentence: 烏陀夷！
translation: Udayana!

source_sentence: 若有癡人，我為其說：『汝等斷此。』
